content.title: Mukhyamantri Sports Development Scheme - Unemployed Young Professional Sportsperson
content.department: Directorate of Youth Affairs & Sports, Government of Tripura
content.details: Launched on 9th February 2024, the scheme aims to generate employment opportunities for young experienced professional sportspersons (Junior Coach) to give a monthly fixed remuneration of ₹20,000/-. The contract is tenable for a maximum period of 12 months, it may be extended or curtailed.
eligibility: The applicant should be a resident of Tripura.
The applicant should be a young sportsperson.
The applicant should be an experienced professional.
The age of the applicant should be between 18 to 40 years (a relaxation of 5 years in the upper age limit for ST/SC candidates).
content.application_process: Offline. Interested applicants should take print of the prescribed format of the application form, fill in all mandatory fields, paste a passport-sized photograph, and submit it to the Director of Youth Affairs & Sports, Government of Tripura.
documents_required: Fitness certificate (Issued by Agartala Government Medical College Tripura).
Good record in service career and integrity certificate (Issued by the competent authority).
Madhyamik Passed Certificate (6 weeks Course in Coaching in Sports) or Course Certificate (Issued by NSNIS or any other recognized institution).
Participation certificate of minimum State Level Competition (Issued by Sports Authority of India/ Schools Games Federation of India/Indian Olympic Association).

faqs.question: What is the monthly remuneration for young professional sportspersons under the Mukhyamantri Sports Development Scheme-Unemployed Young Professional Sportsperson?
faqs.answer: The monthly remuneration for young professional sportspersons under the Mukhyamantri Sports Development Scheme-Unemployed Young Professional Sportsperson is ₹20,000.

faqs.question: How many disciplines are included in the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme includes a wide range of disciplines such as Basketball, Chess, Gymnastics, Hockey, Judo, Squay Martial Art, Table Tennis, Volleyball, Badminton, Athletics, Thangta, Weightlifting, Yoga, and Lawn Tennis.

faqs.question: What is the age limit for applicants under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The age limit for applicants under the scheme is between 18 to 40 years.

faqs.question: Are there any reservations for women within the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, there are reservations for women within the scheme, with 33% reserved seats in each category - Scheduled Castes, Scheduled Tribes, and Unreserved.

faqs.question: Can applicants from outside Tripura apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, only residents of Tripura are eligible to apply for the scheme.

faqs.question: Is there any relaxation in the upper age limit for certain candidates?
faqs.answer: There is a relaxation of 5 years in the upper age limit for candidates from Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes.

faqs.question: Is there any specific coaching certification required for applicants?
faqs.answer: Applicants are required to have completed a 6-week course in coaching in sports or possess a course certificate issued by recognized institutions.

faqs.question: What level of sports competition participation is necessary for eligibility?
faqs.answer: Participation in minimum State Level Competitions is necessary for eligibility.

faqs.question: Are there any provisions for extending the contract period?
faqs.answer: The contract period may be extended or curtailed based on the discretion of the authorities.

faqs.question: Are applications sent via email or courier accepted?
faqs.answer: No, applications sent via email or courier are not accepted.

faqs.question: Is there any reimbursement for interview-related expenses?
faqs.answer: There is no reimbursement provided for interview-related expenses.

faqs.question: What is the mode of assessment for candidates under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Candidates are required to appear for a viva-voice/oral assessment.

faqs.question: Can applicants submit documents attested by someone else?
faqs.answer: Applicants must self-attest the documents; third-party attestation is not accepted.
